devdoc.details: This contract must be deployed via Create2 to the same address on all chains. That way, an errant transaction sent to the wrong chain will be blocked by this contract rather than hitting a dead address. This means that this contract will not work to protect chains, like zkSync, where Create2 address derivations don't match other chains. Source: https://era.zksync.io/docs/reference/architecture/differences-with-ethereum.html#create-create2

deposit(address,address,address,uint256,.details: Protects the caller from losing their ETH (or other native token) by reverting if the SpokePool address they intended to call does not exist on this chain. Because this contract can be deployed at the same address everywhere callers should be protected even if the transaction is submitted to an unintended network. This contract should only be used for native token deposits, as this problem only exists for native tokens.

params.amount: Amount of tokens to deposit. Will be amount of tokens to receive less fees.
params.destinationChainId: Denotes network where user will receive funds from SpokePool by a relayer.
params.maxCount: used to protect the depositor from frontrunning to guarantee their quote remains valid. Note: this is intended to be used to pass along instructions for how a contract should use or allocate the tokens.
params.message: Arbitrary data that can be used to pass additional information to the recipient along with the tokens. Note: this is intended to be used to pass along instructions for how a contract should use or allocate the tokens.
params.originToken: Token to lock into this contract to initiate deposit.
params.quoteTimestamp: Timestamp used by relayers to compute this deposit's realizedLPFeePct which is paid to LP pool on HubPool.
params.recipient: Address to receive funds at on destination chain.
params.relayerFeePct: % of deposit amount taken out to incentivize a fast relayer.
params.spokePool: Address of the SpokePool contract that the user is intending to call.

deposit(address,address,address,uint256,.notice: Passthrough function to `depositV3()` on the SpokePool contract.

userdoc.notice: SpokePoolVerifier is a contract that verifies that the SpokePool exists on this chain before sending ETH to it.
